meanings.definition: To remove from a position of power or authority.
meanings.sent1: The people decided to unthrone the unjust ruler.
meanings.sent2: The rebels planned to unthrone the tyrant king.
meanings.sent3: The citizens cheered as they unthroned the corrupt leader.
meanings.sent4: The vote to unthrone the dishonest official was unanimous.
meanings.sent5: The act of unthroning the dictator brought freedom to the nation.

meanings.definition: To dethrone or depose from a throne or position of power.
meanings.sent1: The knights conspired to unthrone the false king.
meanings.sent2: The queen's advisors plotted to unthrone the traitorous noble.
meanings.sent3: The jester joked about trying to unthrone the royal cat from its cushion.
meanings.sent4: The storm seemed to unthrone the mighty oak tree from its place.
meanings.sent5: The prophecy foretold a hero who would unthrone the evil sorcerer.
